Ha Noi.description: Temple of Literature is located on Quoc Tu Giam Street. The city's most interesting religious building is this beautiful and incredibly peaceful Confucian temple, originally built as a university in the 11th century.
Ha Noi.name: Temple of Literature

Ha Noi.description: Hoan Kiem Lake is located on Dinh Tien Hoang Street. Hanoi's most well-known landmark is tranquil Hoan Kiem Lake, nestled just on the southern edge of the old town quarter
Ha Noi.name: Hoan Kiem Lake

Ha Noi.description: Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum is located on Ngoc Ha Street. A place of pilgrimage for many Vietnamese, the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum is a sprawling complex set within the city's gardens that contains the tomb of Ho Chi Minh as well as various museums and monuments.
Ha Noi.name: Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum

Ha Noi.description: Thang Long Imperial Citadel is located on Hoang Dieu Street. Although it may not look like much at first, Hanoi's Imperial Citadel area was once the vital seat of military power here, and continued in an important strategic role right up to the 1960s and the Vietnam War.
Ha Noi.name: Thang Long Imperial Citadel

Ha Noi.description: One Pillar Pagoda is located on Ba Dinh Street. One Pillar Pagoda (officially known as Dien Huu Pagoda), is named after its extraordinary architecture: The whole construction is built on a single pillar, which is planted in the middle of a lotus pond.
Ha Noi.name: One Pillar Pagoda

Sai Gon.description: Ben Thanh Market is locate in Phan Boi Chau Street. For sightseers, the hot and hectic Ben Thanh Market is almost an obligatory stop, even if only to witness the crammed stalls and market chaos.
Sai Gon.name: Ben Thanh Market

Sai Gon.description: The Reunification Palace, formerly known as the Independence Palace, has had a rich and colourful history since its completion. This landmark, which made its name in world history in 1975, is also one of the most visited attractions in the city as it draws thousands of both domestic and international visitors on an annual basis
Sai Gon.name: Independence Palace

Sai Gon.description: A fine example of Neo-Romanesque architecture, the red-brick Notre Dame Cathedral is a distinctive landmark in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City. Its twin square towers rise almost 60 meters above the city, capped by iron spires.
Sai Gon.name: Notre Dame Cathedral of Saigon

Sai Gon.description: History Museum of Ho Chi Minh City is locate in Nguyen Binh Khiem Street.Within the grounds of the botanic gardens, the Museum of Vietnamese History unveils the country's cultural evolution from the Bronze Age to the early 20th century
Sai Gon.name: History Museum of Ho Chi Minh City

Sai Gon.description: About 60 kilometers from Ho Chi Minh City, the Cu Chi Tunnels are a must-see half-day trip and one of the top tours for visitors to the city
Sai Gon.name: Cu Chi Tunnel

Da Nang.description: Sun World Ba Na Hills is an exotic theme park with lots of recreational amenities perched on a high mountain (1487m above the sea level) in the outskirts. It is located 36km from Danang City Center
Da Nang.name: Ba Na Hills

Da Nang.description: This is a typical Vietnam tourism magnet along the coastline: fantastic, untouched natural scene with transparent sea, white sand, and mysterious primitive jungle with a vast diversity of plants and animals.
Da Nang.name: Son Tra Peninsula

Da Nang.description: The Mountains is a group of five marble and limestone mountains, named after the five elements of the ancient oriental philosophy: metal, wood, water, fire and earth
Da Nang.name: The Marble Mountains

Da Nang.description: The most important trading point of Danang, Han market is popular among local and tourist alike. Located at the grand intersection of Tran Phu Street, Bach Dang Street, Hung Vuong Street and Tran Hung Dao Street, this famous market holds a very important position in the history of the city
Da Nang.name: Han Market

Da Nang.description: It is no coincidence that Nui Than Tai Hot Springs Park has become one of the most popular spots. This place is not only bestowed a majestic natural beauty but also owns hot mineral flow from Ba Na Nui Chua with the highest mineral content in the country.
Da Nang.name: Than Tai Mountain Hot Spring Park

Can Tho.description: Can Tho Market is located on Hai Ba Trung Street. The market is over one hundred years old, built at the same time as the two big markets in Saigon, Ben Thanh Market, and Binh Tay Market. It has the traditional architectural style very beautiful and unique, especially at night. This is a busy shopping center located in the heart of the city.
Can Tho.name: Can Tho Market

Can Tho.description: My Khanh Tourist Village is located between Cai Rang Floating Markets and Phong Dien, with an area of over 50,000m2. The village is considered as a small Mekong Delta – this is a famous eco-tourism point in Can Tho. Coming here, you can enjoy all kinds of fruits in the garden and specialty foods, visit traditional villages and hear the folk songs of the South and join folk games such as tree climbing, bag jumping, pig racing
Can Tho.name: My Khanh Tourist Village

Can Tho.description: Phương Nam Zen Monastery is located in My Khanh Commune, Phong Dien District, 300m from My Khanh Tourist Village. The Temple was started building on July 16, 2013, on an area of 38,016m2. After several months of construction, it was inaugurated on May 17, 2014. Truc Lam Chanh Giac Zen Monastery is designed according to traditional architectural style – curved roof, red tile. However, it is taller and more comfortable the ancient pagodas in Vietnam. The worshipping way is also simpler and focuses meaning more, for example, the Main Buddha just worships the statues of Shakyamuni, Manjushri, and Samantabhadra. The Zen monastery has a spacious campus, the landscape is fresh cool, the bell sound spread far. This is a destination for those who want to look for peace for a mind.
Can Tho.name: Phuong Nam Zen Monastery

Can Tho.description: Located on Bui Huu Nghia Streets, Binh Thuy District, Can Tho City, Binh Thuy ancient house is designed with 5 two-roofed spaces. The house has French architectural style, built in 1870. The ancient house has preserved cultural and historical values. Outside the ancient house, there are many trees and flowers that make it become both ancient and fresh space.
Can Tho.name: Binh Thuy Ancient House

Can Tho.description: Bang Lang Stork Garden is located in Thoi Binh Hamlet, Thới Thuận Commune, Thot Not District. The garden is a place for the ecotourism having the beauty of the countryside famous for thousands of storks. The garden has contributed to the diversity of tourism in Can Tho, attracting many domestic and foreign tourists to visit. In the garden there are many species of storks with numbers up to tens of thousands, they have different characteristics and behaviors. Most of the species come back to the garden in the breeding season from August to January of the lunar calendar. Besides, there are also different styles of birds gather back here, making the garden more Multiform.
Can Tho.name: Bang Lang Stork Garden

Thua Thien Hue.description: The temple is located on a small hill called Hàm Long in the historic city of Huế in central Vietnam. From the historic point of view, Bao Quoc Temple was considered as the three national pagodas of the city during the time of the Nguyễn Dynasty.
Thua Thien Hue.name: Bao Quoc Temple

Thua Thien Hue.description: Hon Chen Temple is situated on a lovely slope of Ngoc Tran Mountain, 10km upstream from Hue Centre. The name “Ngoc Tran'' means Pearl Bowl, originating from the bowl-shape of the mountain. That also gives the temple its name: Hon Chen
Thua Thien Hue.name: Hon Chen Temple

Thua Thien Hue.description: In Hue - one of Vietnam's most sacred lands of Buddhism, Tu Hieu is regarded as the largest and oldest pagoda, and also a famous sightseeing spot with historical and cultural value.
Thua Thien Hue.name: Tu Hieu Pagoda

Thua Thien Hue.description: Bach Ma National Park is one of the most attractive eco-tourism destinations of Hue city in Central Vietnam. Established in 1991, Bach Ma National Park lies 1,200 meters above sea level, covers an area of 22,000 hectares, and reaches Bach Ma Mount’s peak at 1,450 meters. Thanks to the high biodiversity and magnificent natural landscapes, Bach Ma National Park promisingly fills travelers up with diverse experiences and peaceful moments.
Thua Thien Hue.name: Bach Ma National Park

Thua Thien Hue.description: Hue Temple of Literature (locally known as Van Mieu Hue or Van Thanh) majestically lies on the bank of Perfume River, to the west of the Citadel, just 1km from prestigious Linh Mu pagoda.
Thua Thien Hue.name: Hue Temple of Literature

Sai Gon.description:
Hoi Ngo offers diners a diverse menu of Vietnamese folk dishes, rich in country flavors such as: roasted suckling pig, spring rolls, braised vegetables, seaweed shrimp rolls with wild vegetables, sea mushroom hot pot produce,…  
 +91 70950 04567
Sai Gon.name: Hoi Ngo Restaurant

Sai Gon.description:
With a menu of over 80 Central dishes of which 60% are dishes from the paradise city - Da Nang, An Nam Quan is the number 1 delicious restaurant in Saigon not to be missed.  
 +91 70950 04567
Sai Gon.name: An Nam Quan Restaurant

Sai Gon.description:
Emerging among the delicious restaurants in Saigon, Home Cuisine has become a destination for those who are passionate about traditional Vietnamese cuisine. The space here is both ancient and modern, bringing you a traditional culinary tour of Vietnam, throughout thousands of years of history.  
 +91 70950 04567
Sai Gon.name: Cuisine Hometown Restaurant

Sai Gon.description: Rice owns a menu of delicious dishes of three regions such as: Chicken steamed with lemon leaves, young squash stir-fried with beef, steamed crab with beer, grilled squid with tile, crab spring rolls, chicken hotpot with leaves, herbal rice with mai crab. , lotus rice, etc. Along with a sophisticated and luxurious space and owning many garden corners recreating the peaceful countryside, Gao restaurant promises to bring you extremely interesting experiences.
Sai Gon.name: Rice Restaurant

Sai Gon.name: DIAMOND LE DUAN

Can Tho.description: The Cai Rang Floating Market, the largest wholesale floating market in the Mekong Delta, starts around 04:00 and runs until 10:00, meaning that you’ll have to get an early start of the day if you want to visit.The market is about six kilometres from Can Tho, or about a 40-minute boat ride.
Can Tho.name: Cai Rang Floating Market

Can Tho.description:
Address: 01 Hoa Binh, Tan An, Ninh Kieu, Can Tho
 It’s packed with items ranging from clothing and cosmetics to healthcare and electronics. This popular Can Tho mall also has a cinema where you can spend a few hours whenever you need a break from all the shopping
Can Tho.name: Sense City Mall

Can Tho.description:
Address: 44 Phan Boi Chau, Can Tho
 The centuries-old Central Market is a charming shopping mall in Can Tho. It’s mostly a commodity market, but there are other interesting items such as hats and baskets. Even if you don’t really want to buy anything, you should come here to experience the local culture and way of life
Can Tho.name: Central Market

Can Tho.description:
Address: Hai Ba Trung Road, Tan An District, Ninh Kieu District, Can Tho
 Night markets are a great place to see people in action. The Can Tho shopping experience is made even more exciting by visiting Tay Do Night Market, where vendors display their wares and music shows provide entertainment
Can Tho.name: Tay-Do Night Market

Thua Thien Hue.description:
Address:Tran Hung Dao Street 
 As one of the popular places for shopping in Hue, Vietnam, Dong Ba Market is the oldest market in Hue, featuring hundreds of stalls and shops that sell handicrafts, household items, fresh product and clothing at affordable prices
Thua Thien Hue.name: Dong Ba Market

Thua Thien Hue.description: Address: 50A Hung Vuong, Phu Nhuan, Hue
Thua Thien Hue.name: Vincom Plaza Hue
